update.description:
There is a windows warning related to the use of `tolower`, which outputs an `int`.

~~~
warning C4244: '=': conversion from 'int' to 'char', possible loss of data
src\Noise.cc(115): note: see reference to function template instantiation '_OutIt std::transform<std::_String_iterator<std::_String_val<std::_Simple_types<_Ty>>>,std::_String_iterator<std::_String_val<std::_Simple_types<_Ty>>>,int(__cdecl *)(int)>(const _InIt,const _InIt,_OutIt,_Fn)' being compiled
        with
        [
            _OutIt=std::_String_iterator<std::_String_val<std::_Simple_types<char>>>,
            _Ty=char,
            _InIt=std::_String_iterator<std::_String_val<std::_Simple_types<char>>>,
            _Fn=int (__cdecl *)(int)
        ]
~~~

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=sdformat-ci-sdformat8-windows7-amd64&build=12)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-sdformat8-windows7-amd64/12/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/sdformat-ci-sdformat8-windows7-amd64/12/warnings42Result/

I've added a lambda as suggested [here](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/solutions/33196/view.html) but changed it to use `unsigned char` based on the recommendation of [cppreference](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/string/byte/tolower).

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=sdformat-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64&build=630)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/630/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/630/

It kinda takes the fun out of that concise bit of code. :(
